nodes.text: The famed Jedi lightsaber instructor Cin Drallig recorded a holocron. After the destruction of the entire Jedi Order by the Galactic Empire, Drallig's holocron wound up in the hands of a private collector on the ecumenopolis of Denon. Eventually, the collector put the precious artifact up for auction in an event that took place inside the House Vahali cloudcutter. It was the young noble Rin Praji, a member of the prestigious House Praji fascinated with legends of the Jedi and of the Force, who ultimately won the holocron for several million credits.
